article.headline: Mercer 88, Lipscomb 77
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Scott Emerson scored 24 points and Delmar Wilson added 21 points as Mercer held on to beat Lipscomb 88-77 on Saturday night. Lipscomb (7-21, 4-16 Atlantic Sun Conference) led only once in the second half, 43-42, off a layup with 19:23 to go by Chad Hartman, who finished with 11 points. Mercer (12-17, 9-11) answered with back-to-back layups by Emerson and Wilson to take the lead for good, and the Bears extended their lead to 14 with 4:53 left. Lipscomb went on a 14-4 run, cutting it to 78-74 with 50 seconds left off a layup by Hartman. Mercer closed the game by hitting 10 consecutive free throws, and the Bisons never came within a possession of tying the game. James Odoms scored 14 points for the Bears. Lipscomb's Albert Hacker scored 14 points, Corey King 12, Brian Fisk 11 and James Poindexter 10.
